results.title: Hunters of the North Pole
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Mulholland and Nils Rasmussen
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life as far north as it can be lived, with scenes of walrus, seal and polar-bear hunts. Taking us northward to Greenland, the camera records the year’s round for the Inuit of Thule. In the lengthening daylight of spring, they cross the sea ice by dog sled in quest of seal and polar bear, racing towards land with their catch as the ice bridge begins to melt and crack. When the autumn days shorten, the hunters, in final preparation for the months of Arctic night, set out in boats to harpoon walrus.

results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Human Fraility, Julie Stone and Andrew de Groot
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.

results.title: Hunt for a cancer killer
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Michael Sklar and Harold Mayer
results.brief_description: A graphic account of science’s determined search for a chemical cure for cancer, outlining the promising work being done in the field of antibiotics. Includes interviews with scientists and visits to scientific laboratories and hospitals where tests and experiments are being carried out to produce a cancer-killing compound without harming healthy tissues.

results.title: Hungry minds
results.brief_description: A documentary report of the intellectual starvation in countries ravaged by WWII. Schools are now lost in the rubble with homes, hospitals and churches; children gather knowledge of the world from the black markets and the refuse dumps, roving in gangs through the litter of civilisation. From mute faces, eyes stare hungrily, marking the desolation war has wrought in minds as well as bodies. It is here that a beginning must be made: textbooks, writing materials, research equipment, and a thousand other tools of knowledge are needed to break apathy and hostility, and to open young minds to the promise of a peaceful world.

results.title: Hungry i reunion
results.brief_description: This documentary tells the story of the 1980 reunion of some of the entertainers who performed at San Francisco’s “Hungry i” nightclub during the 50s and 60s. The “Hungry i” was a place where the beatniks and bohemians of the day used to gather to see and hear a variety of singers, musicians and stand-up comedians perform their talents on stage, including Lenny Bruce, the Kingston Trio, the Limeliters, Stan Wilson, Jonathan Winters, Bill Cosby among others. Entrepeneur and owner of the nightclub, Enrico Banducci, provided many of these performers an opening to becoming internationally recognised and it is at this reunion they are able to pay homage to the nightclub and its owner. Through interviews, personal reminiscings, stills, archival footage and live on-stage performances, the film presents an inside look at a time and place although long gone is certainly not forgotten. Also features Maya Angelou, Don Asher, Phyllis Diller, John Sebastian, the Hungry i Reunion Trio, Bill Dana. Inspired by the novel “Honeycomb, ballad of a north beach caberet” by Don Asher.

results.title: Hungry angels
results.creator_credit: Reimon Productions, Carlos M. Monson Malice and Marcel Reichenbach
results.brief_description: Instructional film dealing with issue of malnutrition. Follows cases of three children - Maria, born to country peasants; Pedro, child of an urban single mother; and Carlos, the baby of a middle-class couple. As a result of poverty and ignorance, the first two children grow up constantly ill with dysentry and other ailments until, several years later, they are taken to hospital, close to death. The third child is fed well,has regular checkups and grows up healthy and happy.

results.title: Hunger = La Faim
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jordan and Peter Foldes
results.brief_description: Computer animated satire of self-indulgence in a hungry world. Rapidly dissolving, reshaping images, made with the aid of a computer, create a stark contrast between abundance and want. A man eats, at first sparingly, but his appetite grows to gluttony, greed, and gratification of every desire. The nightmare that finally haunts him is the one that hangs over our disparate world. A film without words. Animation, Nestor Burtnyk, Marceli Wein and Peter Foldes. Music, Pierre F. Brault. Editing, Pierre Lemelin.

results.title: Hundred penny box
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Pieter Van Deusen and Leah Miller
results.brief_description: An extraordinary moving story about Michael, his hundred year old great-great Aunt Dew, and his mother, and the “big ugly old box”. The box holds a small sack with a hundred pennies, each a memory of a year of Aunt Dew’s life. Michael likes to count the pennies and listen to the stories that each year evokes. When his mother, burdened by the care of a failing old lady who disrupts the order of her house, wants to get rid of the big ugly old box, Michael is fiercely defiant. His small boy understanding of Aunt Dew is vastly greater than his mother’s. Based on the book by Sharon Bell Mathis.
